title: Michigan boy, 14, is detained after writing on a school assignment shooting made him happy
text:
A teenager in Michigan has been released from custody after writing that 'shooting' made him happy on a school assignment.

The 14-year-old boy was detained by police on Friday after a teacher at the Pontiac School for Excellence said that he had written 'shooting' on an assignment to list things that made him happy.

The teacher said the student also claimed to have a 'kill list' of people to shoot, but the student later said he was joking, and no such 'kill list' was found, according to police.

Police said that they found a list of different guns detailing the ammunition capacity of each, but that they did not find any list of names.

The 14-year-old boy was detained by police on Friday after a teacher at the Pontiac School for Excellence (above) said that he had written 'shooting' makes him happy

'There was no incident. The student was not in possession of a weapon,' Pontiac Academy Superintendent Desmon Daniel said in a video statement. 'The student stated that he had a hit list, however he later retracted the statement saying that he did not have a hit list.'

Daniel said that the student's parents and police officers were summoned to the school, in accordance with school procedure.

He said that the student was questioned and searched in the presence of his parents and law enforcement.

The teen, who was taken to a juvenile detention in Oakland County, has since been released from custody pending further investigation, the Oakland County Sheriff's department told the New York Post.

School officials said that while the student wrote that he enjoyed 'shooting,' he never specified that he liked killing people.

The student had not returned to classes as of Tuesday, Daniel told DailyMail.com, declining to comment further on a disciplinary matter.

'The student did not have any weapons on his person nor in his possession nor was there a “Hit List,”' Daniel said in a statement.

'The student was questioned and released to the authorities and his guardian.'
description: The 14-year-old boy was detained by police on Friday after a teacher at the Pontiac School for Excellence said that he had written 'shooting' on a  list of things that made him happy.
